oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letters from John M. Larimer
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Larimer, John M. (1906-1999)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
A 1928 graduate of Ohio's Wittenberg University, John M. Larimer arrived in Cairo that year a short-term faculty member teaching English. He stayed at AUC until 1930, after which he went into business in the United States and South America. During his time at AUC he served as faculty adviser to the AUC Review and English Honors Society.
The letters to his family in this collection document his thoughts on working at AUC, his life in Cairo as well as Egyptian politics.
The RBSCL is grateful to the Flosi and Porter families for providing digital surrogates of John M. Larimer's letters.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: American University in Cairo -- History; American University in Cairo -- Faculty; Egypt -- Politics and government -- 1919-1952; Egypt
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AUC Oral Histories and Reminiscences; Rare Books and Special Collections Library; American University in Cairo
